::Battera::

She pointed to a room just a few door down from where they were 
standing. "Those are the quarters that were assigned to me."
She had the nagging feeling that he was more of guard to keep her 
confined and less of a would be friend.  She sighed and stopped at 
her room.  She opened the door and walked in.  She motioned for him 
to join her.  "Would you like some berries, oranges, peaches? I have 
a wide veriaty thanks to your food machine in the mess hall. What 
would you like?" She tried to be a pleasent hostess, but she still 
felt uneasy. He was still armed and she wasn't.  He could kill her 
and make up any story he wanted.  His leader would believe him and no 
one would care that she was gone.  

She put on a cheerful smile and offered him some fruit from the bowl. 

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Rex::
> 
> Rex looks at Battera, frowning. So far in his life, he had slagged 
most of 
> the Predacons he had met, and at least shot at every single one. 
And now a 
> Predacon was asking him to go eat fruit with her? He growls 
silently. There 
> were better things to do than eat fruit with Preds, but if nothing 
else, he 
> could keep an eye on her and make sure she didn't get into trouble.
> 
> "Allright. But I think you should tell Kluster whatever you need to 
tell him. 
> I'm just an officer here."
> 
> He starts walking again, "Where did Chordate assign you to?"
